ygData.subject: RE: Sean.Clark@UCHSC.edu
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm, well since your daddy  is done  paying for your college it sounds like an invite to me too. Mail him again and say thanks.  :-) Now for a cheat... In
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm, well since your daddy is "done" paying for your college it sounds
like an invite to me too.
Mail him again and say thanks. :-)

Now for a cheat...

In halas, theres a lady in the pit of despair, I cant recall her name right
now.
Talk to her about ice goblins. She'll tell you to get her 6 beads and bring
them back to her.
Well when I did this I was surprised, I got like 6 iron rations, they sell
for over 2
Gold apiece. The real shocker though was the fact that I got about half a
bubble of exp from it.
The best part of this was I noticed one of the vendors by the 3 tents was
selling those
Beads and cheap! Well 5 minutes & 3/4ths of a lvl later I finally bought her
out of the necklaces.
So whenever you're in halas, remember to just take a peek at these vendors
and see if they
Have beads. I was 4th lvl btw when I did this.
John

-----Original Message-----
From: Sean.Clark@... [SMTP:Sean.Clark@...]
Sent: Wednesday, August 04, 1999 5:13 PM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Sean.Clark@...

From: Sean.Clark@...

LOL...
Hey Lemac: I've NEVER seen a High Elf in court! :)
As to this laughable (but not laudable) supposed lawsuit:
Below is a copy of the email that Nick sent me, exactly as it
appeared to me
(I've included the ENTIRE mail, for those of you that enjoy a good
chuckle.

Please note in the second line of his email that he says that I can
email
him when my 'daddy' stops my college payments. First of all, I
don't
believe that this 'Nick' character has consulted a lawyer (at least
not a
GOOD one). Secondly, even if he DID consult a lawyer, I paid for my
own
education, thank you, and I believe he has given me permission to
email him
anytime I want to!
This incident (that all started with Nick's irrelevant comments
about
camping, and his subsequent flaming of Rebecca have gotten WAY out
of hand,
and are taking up altogether too much of the bandwidth associated
with this
email group.
Chuckle a little if you want....I have :)
But, PLEASE, let's move on and talk about EQ!
Sean Clark
PS: I am FACULTY at the university I have my email at, not a student
:)
Here's the message that nick sent me, in it's entirety:

Obviously I have a job or I would probably be a tweaker like you.
You say
job like you have ever had one, when daddy stops your college
payments then
you can email me and talk. Until then this is your notice never to
email me
again any further emails from you will require a 500 dollar proof
reading
fee, under penalty of law of course. Thank you very much and have a
nice
day.

N.H.
